The modern history which is probably the most interesting in many ways is left till last. I had only 1.5 hours and could have done with 3 so next time I will work in reverse.

Very well presented history of Hong Kong. Really enjoyed the visit here - a great overview of Hong Kong history, presented in a fairly balanced way. Good way to get up to speed for a newbie. MGreat fit out and good material available in English. Great to see disability social enterprise in the cafe.

Interesting overview to history of Hong Kong. Enjoyable museum experience for a visitor. I really did not know much about the history of the area and am not deeply interested in history and so this colorful overview was perfect. It was also interesting seeing the history presented from a different viewpoint from the sympathetic to the English viewpoint I was given as a child. Other reviewers have said that it is a superficial point of view and that is probably fair, however I thought that it was well pitched towards families and visitors on holiday.

"Great Museum". This museum if one of the best I've seen in all my travels, it tells the life story of Hong Kong taking you through the many dynasties, ww2 and the Japanese invasion then onto every life of the h.k. people and their independence from English rule.

An Excellent Museum. We spent several hours in the Hong Kong Museum and only completed three of the five sections due to lack of time.
The exhibits are well presented and information is in both chinese and english.
Well worth a visit if you have a few hours to spare and are interested in in history.
Best place I visited.. Good start for your visit of the city. It provided geology, culture and History. Learned AND felt history!

nice and amysing. The museum is quite big and follows history even from early tectonic plates moving and forming of rocks in this area (this part is a bit long, but after this it gets interesting!). Very good idea for a rainy day

One of best museums I have been too. They did a good job in the museum of telling Hong Kong history from before man to present. Plan at least three hours, more if you watch all the movies. Staff friendly and helpful.

A peek into culture of Hong Kong. We only liked part of the exhibits where they showed the cultures of Hong Kong people - their way of life in the past, celebrations of festivals. To cover everything, you would need prob half a day but we skimmed through most parts Considering the more than affordable entrance fee, I would say visit if you have time and all the more so if you are looking for indoor activities.
Not really a must see. I enjoyed the vist, though the museum is not exactly exceptional. The part with the ethnic groups and the one with post war HK were the most interesting for me.

Great learning experience. Great place to learn about Hong Kong history - cultural, social and geographical - with great exhibits! Takes a couple of hours to go through the whole museum. Great place to stay indoor on a rainy, humid day. Science museum is right next door.

An excellent way to learn about the history of Hong Kong. This is a museum which provides interesting insights into Hong Kong's past, dating back to the Stone Age. There are free conducted tours which make the exhibits come alive for visitors.

Great Place to Learn. I was pleased with this museum. It exceeded my expectations. The geographic history of the area was quite interesting. Understanding all of the influences over time of this area was presented well.i We spent 4 hours here on a rainy day. Do this if you want the historical background.

A good sight into the history of Hong Kong. . The museum shows the history of Hong Kong from the birth of earth up to now. Very easy to find around. It will take you some hours to walk around.The shop and the restaurant was good. I can recommend the museum in a rainy day.
If you care about History. You take a ride to the history of the city. Is interesting for those who like to learn about your destinations. And nice for a rainy day...
INTERESTING. Well worth a visit and lots to see and learn.The children even enjoyed it and looked at all the exhibits.

Well laid out, but not much depth. I was rather underwhelmed by this museum. Its 8 sections do cover everything from Hong Kong's geological evolution to the handover from Britain to China, but all rather superficially. I did find the section on the Japanese occupation interesting.
Beautiful. Very good museum! Very large with lots of information, decoration and illustration! Recommend (on rainy days especially)

So Much History Presented So Well. Visited Hong Kong Museum of History on a rainy Sunday afternoon not knowing what to expect. History covered geological formation of the land right up to the present day. It is a huge exhibit covering a number of floors where you stroll guided through time. There is so much on display ranging from artefacts, dioramas, dwelling recreations, photographs and multimedia presentations. We spent about 4 hours there although my partner and I would have in hindsight have preferred to pace ourselves a little better so that we could have spent more time exploring the last 100 years. There was just so much to take in and the standard of presentation was world class. We found the staff in attendance to be friendly and helpful. The museum is modern, spacious and clean.

Great Museum! Very well designed!. Great Museum! I found it similar to the City of London Museum (in terms of structure) - it felt like walking through History. It took me 6 hours to get through it, it was super-interesting, well designed and organised.The prehistoric section could use a rework, though. I missed some guidance on the timeline and some more detail. Same goes for The Dynasties section. I felt like the it is taken for granted that the visitors know their Chinese history. Some more guidance would be beneficial for the ignorant westerner, like myself. :)If you're limited on time, I would start in SECTION 4, from the folk culture. Anything before can be skipped.The last section felt a bit propagandistic and a bit kitschy, but by that time, I was impressed enough to look past it.

The History and Culture of Hong Kong. The Hong Kong Museum of History is an easy way to prepare for the Hong Kong experience. Allow a few hours to take in the many rooms and exhibits on offer. It is multi-floored so enjoy a walk through the history and culture of this most exciting city.
History. It's a great place to understand the history of Hong Kong where many of the historical traditions and places have disappeared in such a modern city.

Spent a rainy day there.. This museum depicts the history of Hong Kong from early time to present. It's a worth while visit, we stayed over 5 hours, but it can be done in a couple of hours. Go on "free" Wednesday, you save 10.00 HKD
Good intro to HK history. Would recommend this to tourists wanting to get an overview of HK history. Well constructed informative exhibits.

Excellent museum. We went there on a rainy Wednesday, admission is free in all of Hong Kong's museum. Even if you had to pay, it's only $10 HK, which is well worth the time & money. We learned so much about the history of HK. It took the visitor from the beginning all the way to present day. The displays and theaters were fantastic. We easily spent quite a few hours there. Definately worth a trip! Afterwards, we went to the science museum right next to it.

A story telling museum. I went to HK twice so far, for leisure, and both time I spent an hour in this museum. I'm not too into museums if they r just showing some ancient collections. This museum is more like a story teller, HK's history is not too long, and it tells you by showing you period by period. My favorite part is the old Hong Kong culture and tradition, from a fisherman village to a modern city, those 80s' poster, dumpling mountain, opera, tram, the old HK street...

Get to know HK's and South China's fascinating history. Educational presented and authentic settings.Hundreds of eager school classes filled the premises.More than 4000 artifacts, multi-media displays, walk-through theme rooms.Learn about the Opium Wars, British period, Japanese occupation and a lot more.

Excellent displays, well worth a long visit. This is a huge museum, it is filled with amazing displays. The textiles and costumes are superb. Lots of mini theatres with excellent movies, are great to rest your feet. We spent hours here and loved it.

You cold spend the whole day here!. We were very impressed with the range of exhibits from prehistory to modern day. It is well laid out, interactive at times, has great short movies for introducing each section. Excellent!

Second Visit is Well Worthwhile. I wanted to find out about the Japanese occupation of HK on this my second visit. All my needs were met and more. The history of natural disasters was an unexpected bonus.The history of Hong Kong geology would have been greatly enhanced by an account of the contemporary flora and fauna. The stone age and pre history was lacking entirely in dates. The more recent history of HK was vibrant and colurful in its execution.Overall well worth the $5 paid as over 60s.

Very interesting and About 10-15 minutes walk form nearest metro stop.. This was a good museum to visit as it has a wide range of exhibits from prehistoric to local history but not too large, Films, a town layout with building you can walk around and go upstairs depicting the history of Hong Kong.

Interesting history of HK city. We spent about 2 hours one day, then left on a cruise ship, and when we returned we spent another 3 hours at this museum.Entry fee was just over $1 USD for seniors. What a bargain.Displays start with geology and early settlers on the lower level. Than you progress through many different eras - Chinese dynasties, the Japanese occupation, post WW2 boom and the "one nation, two economies" after the British turned HK over to mainland China. Some of the exhibits document a lifestyle that has passed by preserving the "look of the room", others have film clips. We learned a lot about HK, such as the strange opium wars, where the Brits attacked China to force open markets for opium! You can rent a headphone with multiple languages...we did that one day then just read the signs the second day.One of the science museums is right next door. This is NOT on the waterfront.

History made easy. If you want to find out about Hong Kong in a few hours, then you must visit. You can walk through from pre historic to modern Hong Kong. The recreation of the streets, shops and banks are really interesting.

Great displays. This museum on the Kowloon water front is great for spending and hour or so finding out a bit more about the history of Hong Kong. On a hot day or a wet day it is a nice escape. The gift shop has some very nice items for sale. There is also a small cafe beside the museum that is nice for a drink or light meal.

Worth A Visit. We spent three hours in the museum and wished that we had more time. The museum's exhibits of Hong Kong's history are well organized, beautifully presented, and very engaging. There are English explanations at each point. The museum staff were helpful, and we took an one-hour "quick overview" tour, then spent the rest of the time going back and taking more time to look at the exhibits that most interested us. We found the history of Hong Kong very interesting; we knew so little about it before coming to the museum. The museum in on a bus line (I think it was bus #5) that runs directly from the bus terminal near the Star Ferry, so it was easy to get to and from the museum. We took a different bus back, so check the route signs posted at each bus stop.

Wonderful nostalgia. Lovely to re-visit this museum, which contains so much about Hong Kong culture and history. It is great to see what things used to look like in old Hong Kong, and it's even more amazing when you think about how far it's come. We love to visit this museum once every few years, it's a nice, relaxing way to spend an afternoon.

Compact and very well presented story of HK. Great fun and educational activity for adults or families. Highly professionally presented story of HK from neolithictimes to the present, with artefacts and information simply presented.Take the MTR Tsim ShaTsui station (Kowloon side) and take a 20 minute walk through the shopping area's Cameron Road to the museum.Allow 1 hour traveled from Central station and maybe 1-2 hours at the Museum.
Mind blowing trip of the history of Hong Kong. The museum is on about 3 or floors breaking down Hong Kongs history into various aspects. A truly amazing journey

Fantastic . Great experience and beautiful displays. Learned a whole lot about Hong Kong and it's unique history. Would recommend to see if you're in Hong Kong for a few days and appreciate a good museum.

Get to know the real Hong Kong. This well-designed museum with visually engaging displays explains the ins and outs of HK's past, starting with the natural environment and then focusing on the culture, including Chinese and Western influences. Along the way, wander through the old streets of Hong Kong and get a feel for how this place has undergone major changes to become a world-class destination and place to live today.

Still very much worth a visit. Its been some years since the museum opened now but its still an impressive museum and well worth a visit. I particularly enjoyed the section about the different ethnic groups living in HK pre-British take over and the huge hall which has exhibits on the Cheung Chau bun festival etc.

Amazing exhibits, amazing staff, enlightening experience. I was a wee bit behind admission time. Knowing it was my last day in Hong Kong, the staff thoughtfully let me in anyway.The setup allows you to visit the exhibit chronically - you get to learn history of Hong Kong from ancient time to more recent era. Each section sort of gives the vibe of the era it represents. Personally I love to learn about section 6 onward.Will come back at a more appropriate time to learn more, if I have the chance.

Huge Museum! Very informative!. If you are looking for a day to expand your knowledge of Hong Kong, to better understand this interesting city or to even spend a few hours out of the rain, this is the place to go! Entrance fee was inexpensive and the museum is well organized, thorough, and very interesting museum. I would highly recommend this museum to those visiting Hong Kong!

Interesting & Immersive. The HK Museum of History is my favourite museum in HK. Hong Kong has gone through a lot in the past, from the Opium wars to WW2. You'll get to see and experience HK's interesting past. Definitely worth $10.

Rich history. We were pleasantly surprised to find that this is a very detailed, informative, and interesting history museum. Those who don't have much knowledge of Hong Kong will come away with a better understanding of the complex history of this island. We had already been there for two hours before it was closing time and we had to leave, so we still missed probably at least 1/4 of it. Plan for three hours if you're a history lover.

Excellent overiew. This museum takes about 2 hours. You will get a good overview of the four major cultures that co-exist in the region and of the history over the period from early interaction with China, through the Opium wars to present. Well worth the time and fee.

Excellent museum. This really is a great museum. It's very big spacious and clean. Easy to find from hung hom metro. Located next to the science museum. Friendly staff and we'll maintained exhibitions. It has displays on folk culture modern hk past hk etc. Many Mann videos to watch available in English. I loved it here. If you got time you must go. The food in the cafe was very average

Very informative!. A great way to spend a couple of hours in the city. The museum is in chronological order taking you right through the history of HK. Informative - I would recommend this if you have time.

Really Interesting - Not on a Tuesday. We arrived on a Tuesday to find the museum closed. So glad we returned as so much to see and not like a usual museum with glass cases; more of an exhibition through the ages. Interesting take from Chinese perspective on the history told through videos and real life exhibits.

Excellent museum. A must visit place in Hong Kong make sure you have at least 2 hrs available to go around. Really good set up in both English and Cantonese, films about the development of Hong Kong are i both languages as well.

Worth a look. Take an extra layer, it's freezing inside! Interesting and well put together exhibits. May not stack up to some other large museums around the world but gives a comprehensive history of Hong Kong from different perspectives. Kept me and my primary school aged children entertained for nearly two hours. We didn't go into the special exhibit, just the main part of the museum which starts downstairs, you then work your way up in time.

A journey through HK's history. A complete look at HK's history and culture. The museum displays scenery from old till modern times. You feel like experience every era. So much details and precision! Highly recommended for those who what to take a glimpse of HK's amazing history!

The best way to understand Hong Kong's history. I like the museum. I am a local and I go to the museum regularly because it has interesting programme. There is an interesting souvenir shop and I like the artefacts. The staffs are friendly and there are not many customers. What a shame!

An essential stop for anyone interested in understanding Hong Kong's hisotry. This large and ambitious museum encompasses Hong Kong's history from prehistoric times to the current period. It provided lots of information in written and visual forms that helps set a useful context for today's Hong Kong and its relationships with China and the West. I found it quite illuminating.

Interesting and well worth the entrance fee. I went here with my family of five with kids aged 7-11. The kids did not have patience for the entire museum but I think we saw 2/3 of it. Possibly more interesting for the parents than for the kids. I would not mind coming here again on my own to have more time to appreciate all artifacts and see the floor I missed.
Good . Excellent displays and all signage has descriptions in English too, worth a visit (smoke free & aircon an added bonus!)

Impressive . A wonderfully put together experience of Hong Kong's history from pre history to present day. Some fantastic exhibits such as a life size junk and a mock up of Chinese Opera. The videos accompanying most of the exhibits were very informative and clear.Well worth a visit !

Interesting walk through history. Very well set out museum that gives you a real feel for the life changes of the people of Hong Kong.Amazing to see all the items of the sixties, made in Hong Kong, to find that they don't make anything now and import everything even water.Thoroughly enjoyable two hours.

You Must Visit to Find Out More. We were unsure about visiting a museum in such an amazing city, but we are so glad we did. Probably the one thing we would do differently would be to visit it First. It gives you the full history of the country, where they came from, the wars they were involved in, how they operate now, and everything in between. It provides perspective on many other things as you travel around Hong Kong and helps you understand the architecture and more.

Spacious and Organized. If you only have time for one museum, this is the one. It's cheap to get into and free on Wednesdays, and with rain being a common occurrence in Hong Kong, makes for a good activity if you'd like to be inside. This place is huge, with tons to see and many very large, detailed exhibits, taking you from the very first inhabitants of the Hong Kong area and it's geography, up to the present day, with major points in history being explained sch as the Japanese and British occupations. The museum is broken into 8 sections and there are signs that show you in which direction each portion lies, and also shows you a recommended starting point which is nice. Be sure to check out whatever specialty exhibit is on at the time as well. You'll spend at least a couple hours here, if not more, depending on how many of the movies you want to watch and how much information you choose to read. Even without reading much, certain areas are so detailed you'll catch yourself starting at exhibits for a long time taking it all in.

Excelllent Localized History Museum. Hong Kong has a VERY interesting history, I actually knew most of it before visiting here but still learned a great deal. Entrance fee is so low it's practically free. Even my wife, who is not a history buff, enjoyed it.

A Good Way to Learn a Bit of Hong Kong's History. My husband and I ended up visting the Hong Kong Museum of History to 1) get out of the rain and 2) just wander around at our own pace and found this quite good and informative. There are alot of plaques written in English and Chinese which gives you a sense of what exactly you are looking at.

Informational. As a museum should be.. The temporary expo about the Ming dynasty was okay, but the permanent exhibits about Hong Kong was very fascinating, entertaining, and informative. Definitely worth a visit to learn more about the city.

A must-see if you've only got time for one musuem to visit. I really love this museum. I've been many times since I've moved to Hong Kong and I always bring there people who come to visit me. It gives a good introduction to the history of Hong Kong through the years with some nice displays and videos. It's perfect for kids and you can really spare a few hours there and learn a lot about Hong Kong.

Fun and Educational. Fantastic museum with 8 exhibit sections: The Natural EnvironmentPrehistoric Hong Kong The Dynasties: From the Han to the QingFolk Culture in Hong KongThe Opium Wars and the Cession of Hong KongBirth and Early Growth of the CityThe Japanese OccupationModern Metropolis and the Return to ChinaLots to see, explore, discover, learn in each area. It was a really well put together and fascinating experience. Highly recommended - not a boring stuffy museum. They've re-created several historic and cultural scenes and you can walk through them in a sort of interactive way.Some have recommended seeing this museum when you first arrive, but I saw it at the end of my trip and felt like I was able to absorb more that way. Anytime you're able to visit will enrich your experience of Hong Kong. Cost is 10 HKD for adults. Open 10a - 6p, until 7 on weekends. Closed Tuesdays. Apparently there is free admission on Wednesdays. Located in the same area as the HK Science Museum.
Very good overview of the history of Hong Kong. Found this museum very well organised, comprehensive story of Hong Kong, easy to find your way around and interesting exhibitions.

Great to do first day. We did this on our first day here. Our flight got in at 4:30 in the morning so we needed something low key. The price is right....just 10 hkd for adults and 5 hkd for kids. We went through the special exhibit first......once I saw several blue and white Ming dynasty bowls, I was done and so was our 7 year old. We didn't realize that was only the tip of the iceberg. If you go down the escalators in the main hall, you'll see the best exhibits! Lots of interactive stuff for the kids (instead of the special exhibit where you weren't barely allowed to talk). Definitely worth the visit!

Great for kids. I was hesitant to walk in as we were really planning to enter the science museum next door but we didn't know that they closed during Thursdays. Looking into the exhibit for the main lobby, it didn't look promising but we were all delightfully surprised what we found as we walked through. The mock-up city and prehistoric Hong Kong themes exhibits were fun for the kids and we had a great time touring the facilities. There were old trams, boats that helped you imaging what old Hong Kong looked like. Thumbs up!
Interesting. I wandered around this museum for a morning. Really informative and great displays. Watched film as well.

Good rainy day visit. Interesting displays showing the history of Hong Kong from the earliest times to reunification with China. Also another temporary exhibition with beautiful items from the Ming dynasty. A good way to spend a few hours on a miserable day and very reasonable at 10 HKD or 5 HKD for over 60s.

Go on Wednesday, when it's free. My wife rates this as the best museum of local history in the world. Walking through this fabulous place, you are taken from prehistoric times, through Chinese dynasties, the English colonial period and on to 1997, when Hong Kong became a Special Administrative Region of China.The Hong Kong Science Museum's entrance is across the courtyard, so we saw two world-class museums in one morning, for free.

A great place for the whole family. A fantastic museum! A great way to understand Hong Kong and walk through its history. Very well set up suitable for all ages. its very affordable for $10 per person and on Wednesday its free. I have taken visitors there whom all thoroughly enjoyed it

One for the rain. This one probably depends on what you think about museums in general, although it's fairly well done and quite extensive you can't really get away from the fact that this is a local history museum. Ideal if it's raining and you can't go and see something more interesting I guess. Or if you're really interested in the long history of Hong Kong then there is plenty of depth.Some of the bits I found the most interesting were the more recent editions about the handover from the British etc.
Great museum. Great museum, like 10 dollars to visit, or you can get a combination ticket for all the museums for like 30 HKD. It's a good place to get a feel for the city and it's history, 2-3 hours

Very interesting, definitely a wet day visit. It was poring and I searched on line for things to do.Ah the HK museum of history and it's a free be.Got there via the MYR and it wasn't free but they gave me the senior price of 5HK$.Their was an exhibit of porcelean and all things chinese from 12th to 16th century.It was superb some lovely pieces and very well presented.Then their was a time line exhibition from 400 million years ago to day. Incredibly well done with lots of shows and streets set out.Well done guys well with a visit.

Fantastic history of HK. Whether you are 9 or 90 you cannot fail to be impressed by this museum. The guided tour is 1st rate and takes you from pre-history to the development of modern HK. The museum is air conditioned which makes any visit really comfortable.

Fine for a rainy day. Big museum with approx. 6 themed areas. Not too many exhibits and artifacts, but some stories focused on the themes - may be a good thing. Has two parts - standing exhibit and special exhibitions. If you get the audio tour you have to choose between the two - bit odd, but there is probably only enough time to do one or other and it only costs HND 10 for the audio guide anyway.

interesting museum, fine Ming exhibition. The history museum is very well organized, and for tourist who want to learn more about the history and traditions of Hong Kong the 'Hong Kong History' (permanent, I believe) exhibition is highly recommended. The current exhibition with art from the Ming dynasty period open for a few more weeks is highly recommended.

Time condensed. There is something here for almost everyone- geology, anthropology, musicians, art, culture, war, history(of course) and fun. I could have spent much more time here and yet was able to get a lot from just over an hour. The place is very accessible from the admission cost to the excellent wayfinding and docents eager to guide your way. Audio tours in several languages are offered and cheap. The exhibits don't gloss over sticky issues like the opium trade, sex traffic and politics so be prepared to come away with a new perspective on the past and the present it has brought.

Worth visiting. Well worth the 10 HKD for the standard admission ticket.We found the exhibition really interesting. Everything is presented in a very attractive way, not a boring museum visit. Make sure you have enough time. We came an hour or so before the museum closed and found it a pity to leave before we had explored everything. Also recommended when travelling with children.

Amazing set up and history. This museum needs to be on every visitor's must do in Hong Kong. Apart from the vivid History the displays were awesome.It certainly captured my full attention and i wish i had more time there.The history of HongKong in its creation and continued landscape changes were very interesting
unplanned visit but worth every minute. Came across this when walking around the area, Absolutely amazing exhibitions. very cheap, allow as much time as you have got to explore - stunning!

Enjoying even as a local. The exhibition was informative even for locals, and it includes fundamental history of HK.Free tour guides are passionate, giving great depth of knowledge that are not on display.Highly recommended to everyone!

Amazing Museum. We went to the museum the first day of our trip and it worth it. It takes you to the beggining of everything to understand its geography, economy and history. It is very well organized by sections of history. It is interactive, there are reconstructed houses, boats, towns. There are also videos explaining what you will see in each section. We were going to visit it for a couple of hours, but it took us more than 4 hours! It was really nice.

A little history? We spent all day there!. What an interesting day! A must for those who are interested in history and a country's story. My husband and I visited with the intention of spending a couple of hours seeing the museum. We became lost in time and spent all day there. Great stuff!

Informative, very god way to start a trip to Hong Kong. Very easy museum to walk around. All the information is very clear, easy to understand and available in English. The museum provides a great foundation for the beginning of a trip to Hong Kong as it provides loads of information about the islands that make up the city and what you can see and do. Also the Ming Exhibition was a great add on. It had great artifacts to look at. I visited early on in the day during the week and although there were a few school groups visiting it was very quiet. The museum is free to enter on a wednesday but i think it was well worth the 10 HK Dollars i paid to enter.
Small accessible museum of maritime trade. A very charming museum for old and young. A broad variety of objects from Ceramics to paintings as well as maritime history.

Wonderful Exhibition "The Radiant Ming 1368-1644". Our last day in Hong Kong and we decided to visit the Museum of History and to our great surprise and wonderment they had a special exhibition "The Radiant Ming 1368-1644" - as the Ming period is my particular favourite, this was a superb experience for me. The ceramics and furniture plus all sorts of items from the Ming period were beautifully displayed and annotated in Chinese and English. All I did was ooh and ahh as the quality of the ceramics were exceptional. I did want to purchase the catalogue but it was so large and heavy I had to leave it, but am hoping to order one via post. This exhibition is on until the 11th of April 2016 and I would urge people to visit it as it us stunning. Thank you so much.

Superb audio guide, first class exhibition. This museum is a great example of what a modern museum should look like. Firstly, there is a great variety of displays, from reconstructed houses and boats, to a whole "mini town", displaying how people lived through the ages in Hong Kong.Secondly, there are 4-5 min video overviews in every section to give you an oversight before or after viewing the exhibits. Thirdly, there is an outstanding audio guide, with the perfect balance between being informative but not drowning you with facts, and being long enough to get a good understanding but without tiring you out by the second room.You can easily spend 5-6 hours here without noticing.A top museum that should (and is, if you consider how the Museum of London recently upgraded itself) be an example to the rest of the world on how to create a history of a city museum.

Good Overview of Hong Kong. This is an important stop for any tourist who thinks that HK is just about shopping and dimsum. Very enlightening to learn about the various historical aspects of HK, including its diverse geography, and inspiring to see how it rose to its current status.

very good efforts by the government. well presented and the props are well thought out too. its free on Wednesdays! ;)unfortunately I only allocated a couple of hours for this place which apparently wasn't enough.

Really interesting. We went there because we heard from some friends that it was an interesting visit. And it was indeed! The museum is greatly organised and very detailed in the different stages of HK's history. The presence of 1:1 of typical tea shops, post offices etc makes the visitor plunge into the narration. Videos all along summarise what had just been seen (and read), which ends up being a bit repetitive: either one or the other... But the 8-mins-videos were really well done and were scheduled in three languages.The tour takes a while (it took us over 3 hours) but it is totally worth it! And it is very cheap :)

Creative and interesting!. Pennies to enter. Huge knowledge gained! The museum was incredibly well laid out and went through the entire history of Hong Kong. Extremely interactive with interesting videos, touch screen interactions, paintings, exhibits, rein-actions and relics. You can spend as little or as much time as you want, but worth it to squeeze into the trip to learn about the history of the city.
Learning Experience. Excellent for developing a geological, economic, and political understanding and appreciation for the history of Hong Kong. Affordable and easy to access. Highly recommmend.

Well worth a visit. If you are interested in the origins of Hong Kong this is the place for you as it shows in many fascinating ways the development of the country. Museums are free on Wednesdays but this January most museums were free!

Nice Museum. This museum was fun and interesting to visit. It has a good presentation on the history of Hong Kong before and after the colonial time, It also present some of the custom and culture in the past. We had a great visit.

A museum not to be missed!. We thought we would visit this museum on our last day in HK. The reviews were good. We weren't sorry. It is huge! It took a couple of hours to get through the museum and could take longer. The whole history of Hong Kong is in that building. It was so well done and it was like walking into the real history, with streets, shops and talking movies. It was a real eye opener of Hong Kong in the early days right up to modern times.

Modern exhibits to portray history. Great for families of all ages, but don't expect many authentic historical artifacts. The exhibits are entertaining and educational. Entry is cheap. Well worth a 90 minute stroll, but not comparable with the British Museum.

My personal history book.... It explained all that my grandparents and father experienced and I was moved by the exhibits. My son was also moved. The way herbal store and touring Opera troops were. My paternal grandfather opened the first Herbal store in Winnipeg, and my mother was in amateur opera in her youth. I came to understand my dad's experience in HK, China during the Japanization.

Great day out! . I had a great day out here, I love history and dragged two of my friends around the museum and they ended up loving it too! The museum is really interactive. Hong Kongs history is unique and colourful and this museum actually makes you feelA part of it!!

The gem of Hong Kong. We are a family of history lovers, and with our family history deeply entwined in the far eastern colonies, we love exploring old museums and preserved precincts such as 1881 in Hong Kong. The Hong Kong museum rates up there with the best! We spent hours there, walking through the interactive displays, reliving our colonial past in splendid authentically rebuilt shops, banks, homes, whole streetscapes. The museum is a wonderful homage to Hong Kong, from sitting through a 3d film of how the land formed with volcanos hissing overhead; to an excellent record of WW2 occupation via film, photography and display. Don't miss this amazing museum.

Visited "The Hong Kong Story" exibit. I LOVED this museum. It was huge. There were two sections to it, the Hong Kong story and the ming dynasty. The second one was their special exhibit but living in mainland China, I had already seen many things relating to the Ming Dynasty and I was in Hong Kong and wanted to know more about it. This was a fun, interesting way of looking at it and only 10HKD which was BY FAR the cheapest thing I did my entire stay in Hong Kong. It took me over 3 hours to properly see everything. There were a total of 8 galleries in this exhibit and all had authentic items, replicas, and a video theater. Again, loved it.

Bets museum in Hong Kong. Spend a whole day here with audio guides going through the galleries of Hong Kong history from prehistoric to the hand over, lots of use of vidios some lovely clothes and amazing street scenes.

Lots of variety. The HK Museum of History was fascinating. We spent several hours and still didn't see all of it. I would go back again.It is right across from the Museum of Science (closed when we were there).

I finally understood the complex Hong Kong history. After a couple of days in Hong Kong, I needed to understand the totality of the Hong Kong complex history. The relationship to Europe, Britain, China. The different settlements. The links to second world war and the Japanese invasion and the role as a rising good producer in the mid 20th century and onwards and how it became a financial focal point. So, a visit to the History Museum seemed like the best bet. And it did´t let us down. Comprehensive and well illustrated. Nothing spectacular, really, as many history museums are good these days, but a good job by the curators and an appreciable amount of movies accompanying the different "chapters" to make getting through the exhibits easier. We came just as approx. 150 schoolchildren did a museum visit. They were so well behaved, though, so it was just a positive and enjoyable extra addition to the visit.
Unmissable. Never avoid making a stop at this museum since it contains highly visual displays that are interesting enough to know more the city in an entertaining and enjoyable way.

An excellent introduction. The "Hong Kong Story" which is part of the permanent exhibit here is an excellent introduction to Hong Kong history. A friend of mine hates history museums but loved this one. It makes the history come alive.
Worth to visit. It is worth to spend ca 2 hours learning about history of Hong Kong. You can watch few movies in English or with subtitles about the history and traditions.

Great. Many museums these days are packed full of televisions and interactive displays, this place has actual stuff. It's very informative and doesn't leave out any of the awkward truths in HK's history. Good for all the family. Cheap too!

Great way to spend a few rainy hours. The museum is amazing. While a bit difficult to follow at times, the audio guides were very useful. Plan to spend 3 hours to do the entire museum properly A must for history buffs.

Great Museum. Well presented displays from the beginning of time to the present. Well done texts to accompany the artefacts and various cultures. Two dollars well spent. Merchandise in the gift shop way over priced. Sometimes difficult following the displays in a chronological order.

Excellent display of life in old Hong Kong. I was pleasantly surprised that the museum was free admission for the entire month of January. Inside the museum displays artifacts, photos and video presentation of life of old Hong Kong chronologically, complete with old Chinese Music appropriate for the era. It was like walking back to history and re-living in Hong Kong. It was quite a nostalgic trip for history lovers.

A great deal for a great deal of history. This museum is one of the many in Hong Kong with free admission on Wednesdays and is one of my favorites in Hong Kong because it has so much information. You will most definitely leave with a much greater understanding of Hong Kong historically, culturally and geographically. The main Hong Kong history exhibit covers two floors and has eight sections, so try not to get too bogged down in the prehistory (unless it's your thing). You may have museum burn out before you get to the really interesting periods. Finally, don't forget to check in on the rotating exhibits. They often have great collections of painting and photography borrowed from other museums.

Beautifully presented . Fabulous day at this wonderful museum. It is laid out in a most interesting way, providing a logical flow while at the same time letting you meander through various sections. I could spend a couple of days here. A bit too dark in places and school groups seemed to congregate at times in the passageways rather than in off to the side areas, but at least they were there learning! Highly recommend any visitors to Hong Kong visit here early in their trip to get a better understanding of the place. Kudos to those who manage this museum.

An excellent Museum and Good Value. On our first day in Hong Kong (Kowloon) we walked from our hotel (Harbour Grand) along the promenade into Kowloon and up Chatham Road South to the History Museum. They have an excellent display that shows the development of HK from pre-historic times to the present day with the various ages dealt with in separate galleries.Entrance was $5.00 each for age concessions (£0.46) and another $10.00 for the audio tour (£0.92). The galleries covering the 1700 to present day I found the most interesting and a bit of an eye opener with respect to the Opium Wars and the Japanese occupation. We whiled away a couple of hours here including a very reasonable cup of coffee. If you have some spare time this is an excellent attraction.
Knowledge. This is a great place to visit when you like to know more about Hongkong history from ancient time to present. The museum was greatly made and preserve.
nothing special. I have been a couple of times- honestly, this place is not the best. if you want to go to a museum go to the medical history museum of the heritage museum.

Very interesting museum which makes a good synthesis of HK history. Tip : the museum is free on Wednesdays. You'll need between 3-4 hours to wander quietly along the exposition. Interesting to have an overview of HK history!
Worth visiting. All museums are free on Wednesdays. This museum is located opposite the Science museum. Both worth visiting.
Spectacular. One of the unsung museum heroes of Asia. Every time I come back here I learn more about HKG and am glad I returned. Well set up, good explanations, lots to see.

Wish I came here earlier. Having been back in HK for so long, never thought about coming here until a friend to me how awesome it is. If you want to know about the history of Hong Kong, this is the place to be! Free on Wednesdays anyway (not including special exhibitions), so you can't really go wrong!

Excellent museum - a must visit. If you want to find out a more about the history of Hong Kong, then a visit to this museum is definitely worth while. The exhibits are really well done and very realistic. It made our visit to Hong Kong so much more interesting and I feel much more informed now about its past history and present position in the world economy.
Wonderfully presented and HK$10. Very worthwhile attraction if you want to know about HK history. Very well presented, with plenty of video footage and excellent displays.

Been twice and there's still so much too see!. The Hongkong Museum of History is a definite must-go when in Hong Kong. You might be blinded by all the shopping in Tsim Tsa Tsui but this is quite the hidden gem. It's main exhibit is "The Hong Kong Story" which takes you from prehistoric to modern Hong Kong -- it's pretty much science and history all in one! Of course, being an avid history geek, I really enjoyed how they broke down Hong Kong's history into periods and designed all the areas with a great attention to detail. You won't find museums that actually let you inside the displays and have life-size models of structures (Tip: Watch out for the 10-meter Bun Tower!). Take two to three hours in this amazing place. You won't regret it!

Informative and Entertaining. This is one of my favourite museums because it's visually interesting. They have massive scale replicas of villages and local customs (like the bun climbing competition).
Don't miss the exhibition on the Opium Wars upstairs!
Excellent. From prehistory to present day, a fantastic insight into the growth of this amazing place. Very well presented in themed areas, highly recommended

Very modern museum. It is divided to a number of sections and very well organised. Each section has a screen to play well document movies worth wAtching. You would need more then a day to see it all so if you are on a short visit choose sections you like rather then following numbers

Great Museum to Get More of a Feel for Hong Kong. This museum provides a lot of information about Hong Kong's history in a really nice way with well thought through exhibits. We loved how they had so many scenes from throughout the history of Hong Kong. I especially liked the houses and shops that had been donated and reassembled in full so that you could actually walk in them and get a better feel for history.

Much better than expected. I went here on a rainy morning, not expecting anything too wonderful. In fact it was one of the better museums of history I've been to. The ground floor exhibits about geology and flora/fauna are a little dry, but things improve vastly by Gallery 4. If you start with the Opium Wars and move up to the 1997 British Handover, it's very interesting. Lots of short films that illustrate topics quite nicely. I found the exhibits on the WWII occupation to be especially poignant. Visit this early in your trip, and later what you see walking around will make better sense to you.

Not your standard museum. It's a long metro ride to get there but worth the visit. Interesting, albeit unusual, displays like the history of Cantonese opera, Bruce Lee exhibit, along with the permanent collection of Asian antiquities. Great for a rainy day excursion.

Open the dusty pages of history.... I could have spent more time here, but alas... we were a little time constrained with the cruise's departure later in the afternoon. However, I would recommend this to anyone that is a history buff. There are lots of interesting items that are very well laid out. The staff are approachable and professional. The amenities at the museum are impeccable. So once you get past the basics... you can settle in and enjoy this wonderful display of historical artefacts. There are heaps of information boards that are in English as well as the local language. What can I say.... just do it!
Traditional Hong Kong History. Especially worth the visit with teenagers as they always are interested in the story behing all the countries they visit

More historic items?. Felt like reading a hogh school history book, tough was let walked a lot. If they displayed more historic items like desks and chairs or other , could have made us imagine the real life of older days.

Great background on HK. Went there on the first day I arrived and truly enjoyed this museum. It is pretty huge and a lot of things to see so do keep aside some time to view them all. A good place to understand the background of HK and how it came about. And its free entry on Wednesdays!

Fab way to spend a couple of hours. We had landed in Hong Kong early from a long haul flight so were very tired. However we didn't want to lose a whole day so we ambled along the waterside and on to this museum. The history of Hong Kong was very well done and explained a lot about this place we were about to spend a few days in. Excellent!

Best Place for History Lovers. I visited this place on Wednesday so I got a free entry. This place was recommend to me by a co-traveller. It has videos playing in different languages to assist you. It also has voice assited meusem guide.

Nice historical insight. Here, you can find a nice overview of the entirety of Hong Kong's history, from the beginning of time to present day. There are lots of wonderfully decorated exhibits and a few movie rooms with documentaries in different languages.On Wednesday it is free entrance.
Cheapest attraction in HK. Very large and nice exhibits. Can easily spend a whole day here. Entrance is so cheap and I guess Wednesdays are even free.

great museum. This museum offers a comprehensive view of Hong Kong's history. Perhaps too comprehensive in places--I'm not a fan of geology--but mostly interesting and sometimes fascinating. The gift shop is really good, too.

An interesting couple of hours.. We didn't find the early history part of the museum particularly interesting but loved the folk traditions part. Viewing the insides of houses, costumes and puppets was the best bit for us. There is a very good museum shop with unusual things to buy/browse.

I learnt so much about Hong Kong. This is a wonderful museum describing Hong Kong from prehistoric times to the present. We spent too much time at the beginning, and ran out of time at the end. The museum is organized chronologically. I recommend that you move quickly through the prehistoric and flora/fauna stuff (unless that is your major interest) because the later exhibits are larger and more fascinating, describing the culture and recent history.
Informative Interesting. Nice collection, informative especially the movies about China handover, Japan war and the fishing village

Fantastic intro to socio-econ history of HK. One of the 4 museums I visited on this trip. Great content to keep adults and kids occupied for more than entire afternoon. Do attend the theaterette, especially "Theatre/Video Show: Drama is Life – Entertainment in Hong Kong in the 1960s and 1970s"

Hong Kong at its best. It is an example of how thing are organized in Hong Kong: clean, informative and easy to access. We were lucky to visit a "Radiant Ming" exhibition - real masterpieces from many collections. Private collections which are very rarely seen.

History Buff. If you are a history buff, this is the place to go to. The museum comprises of a huge building with a few storeys. The exhibit starts frm the prehistoric era frm the rocks to the early settlers in China to the various dynasties and to Hong Kong. It also has ancient "houses" that you can walk through to have a feel of the past and how the different cultures celebrated their festivities in the past. The upper storey even has a historic walk ways that takes you back to pre and post-war Hong Kong as well as the opium war. It is definitely worth a visit. Check out their website as they have different special exhibitions set up in their front hall every few months. It is free admission every Wednesday, but I say it is worth every penny for hkd10 on other days.

'twas a wet afternoon...... spent a wonderful 4 hours at this excellent and very well presented museum. My teenage children loved learning the history of the opium, the trade, and the dreadfully corrupt British Navy!!

Fantastic space to spend a rainy morning. Spent a lovely morning at the history museum, wandering through the exhibitions. It starts a bit slow with the natural environment but builds nicely into the big historic displays, full of colour and life. I was a bit disappointed with the cafe, was hoping for a small snack for my four year old but it only had set meals. Would throughly recommended it for a visit.

Good option for a rainy day. Free entrance to the Museum during January 2016. It is a good option for a general introduction to Hong Kong History with information from the different chronological stages. There are also a few small cinema rooms projecting some short videos about history, traditions and culture and climatology, both in Chinese and English. Personally, the area I enjoyed most was the representation of the old houses, shops and theaters.

Great Museum. Very well done museum. This is a good way to spend a few hours of your trip. Take a look at the weather forecast and if you're there during a rainy day this is the perfect way to kill some time.
Raining spot . It was raining and we had to kill some time. The historical part is interesting but the beginning on the natural history of Hong Kong could be done without.
Lots of history told in an accessible and lively way. So much to see as you wander from one big impressive exhibit to another - lion dances, Chinese opera, HSBC and much more.A must-visit.

Probably the nicest history museum I've seen. This is a very well done museum. Very nice exhibits. It is the history of HK from geology to human migration to politics to modern living. It was much better than I expected. I think it is a good rainy day activity.

A good way to learn HK's history. The flow of the museum allows for you to travel through time in Hong Kong. I personally didn't find the first half of the museum very interesting, although it was very informative. Once it got to British colonization and Japanese control, it got very interesting to me. We learnt a lot across a three-hour visit and then retired to the cafe for a meal. Here, too, was a surprise: it is run by an organisation offering jobs to the disadvantaged.Highly recommended.
Great day. What a wonderful place clean fresh and full of information spent almost all day there lots to see and do

Rainy day?. While we were in Hong Kong for only a short while it rained the whole time and I didn't have much free time. However, the one Saturday I did have I walked less than 15 mins from my hotel (might have gotten a little distracted along the way) and went to see the history museum. It was free to get in, but I paid the $10HKD to get the audio tour headset. I spent over four hours walking and learning, going to all of the interactive exhibits I found. This is a great afternoon, especially in adverse weather conditions. I think it would be fun for a family as well.

Nice museum with history of Hong Kong. Spent about 2 hours here on a rainy day and enjoyed ourselves. We could have spent more, but our brains were full. A very informative history of HK from prehistoric geologic times through the last years with China. Well done and worth a visit. We will likely go back. Bonus is all HK museums are free in January.

Hong Kong history all laid out.. This museum actually surprised us. It was better then we thought it would be. My adult son and I thought we'd probably spend about 2 hours here but we found the exhibits so captivating that we ended up staying well over 3 hours.The museum traces the history of Hong Kong right from the prehistoric periods, through the various Chinese dynasties, then colonialisation, Opium Wars, Japanese occupation and right through to the 'hand over' to the PRC.The exhibits are delightfully constructed and always interesting especially those devoted to HK's modern history.Totally recommended if you have an interest in HK's evolution from humble fishing village to global center.

Learnt something new. Came here by myself on a very hot day so good way to get out of the heat. My knowledge of hongkong was a bit limited but learnt a fair bit more after visiting. Well worth the visit.

Hong Kong History Museum of History. Very informative and interesting, well worth a visit. It took us more than the couple of hours to see and hear everything which including renting a headphones and watching the various film presentations. Bruce Lee is NOT at this museum as review by ZuZu. Bruce Lee is at the Hong Kong Heritage Museum and is not quite as interesting as the Hong Kong Museum of History.All the museums are free for the whole month of January as the government is trying to get the people out to the museums.

Free in January!!. All museums in HK are FREE in January! This was a great museum to help me gather a better understanding of this culture and history. It's perfect for both young and old. And the Science museum is literally right across the pathway. 2 attractions for 1 (regarding convenience.)

Strongly recommend checking out 'The Hong Kong Story' exhibition. We had to shelve our trail walking plans because of the weather. We were glad we did so since that made us check out alternative plans such as visiting the HK Museum of History. It was a coincidence that admission to all museums in HK is free for the whole of January.The HK Story exhibition is an excellent exhibition. There was so much information presented on how Hong Kong evolved from the prehistoric times until now, in various aspects such as geology, World War, entertainment, politics, people, and culture. It is clear that no expense or effort has been spared in putting together this exhibition. Many props and fittings have been painstakingly designed and put together to make it as interactive and easy to understand as possible. We could almost feel like we were transported back to those times.When we were hungry, there was an in-house HK style tea restaurant that served up bowls of very excellent wanton noodles. The toilets are very clean too. I was quite impressed with the cleanliness of the toilets.While we did not have time to check out the Science Museum, we thoroughly enjoyed our time at the Museum of History. We have learnt so much about the history of Hong Kong. This visit was the highlight of our trip to Hong Kong.Great job!
Wonderful Museum. Wonderful museum to learn the history of Hong Kong. Well laid out and pleasant to visit. Plan on a couple of hours for your visit.

Worth the visit. From the outside it doesn't really look all that appealing, but once you get inside, a whole other World opens up to you.We were visiting from Thailand & it was very good to be able to see the Culture & History of another Far Eastern place.You are taken from the very beginnings of Hong Kong (prehistoric times) right through to the Modern day. Make sure that you make time to watch some of the short films, especially about WW2, very eye opening.If you are in Hong Kong for a few days, then i would highly recommend you take time out, from shopping & sightseeing, to spend a few hours learning about the real culture of the place.

Deceiving Exterior. The looks a little old on the outside but the inside tells a different story. This is a fantastic museum that crafts the story of Hong Kong, sharing the seismic shifts that brought it from geological beginnings to modern day mega city.The exhibits are well put together with a attention to detail. The collection is broad, ranging from prehistoric pieces to archival footage and memorabilia. The sections on different ethnic communities is especially well done.If you've a couple hours to get away from the hawker stands and walk off your last big meal, check out the museum.

Eye opener. Look out for the various audio visual short films in the various sections.basement section closes at 5.30 but reat is open upto 7pm.the section relating to the second world war era is very informative.take about 2 to 3 hours to visit ....overall a must visit

Short Story Long. Hong Kong is a metropolitan established for less than 200 years. It is not long in history if you compare to other metropolitans, but it truly contains a deep story from the establishment of colonial Hong Kong to today. Here you can find so much proofs of how the Britians spread their seeds and to make Hong Kong shines today. It also contains traditional architecture, agriculture and culture of Hong Kong, like the Hakka.

Shows daily life of ordinary hong kong people. This is a wonderful experience and extremely well organized. I loved depiction of daily life over the last 200 years along with small audotoriums showing short 8-10 mt videos. Many exhibits are interactive e.g getting onto old tram coach and boat of boat people.Give it at least 3-4 hours.

Wonderful museum. Not just for a rainy day. We picked this museum because it was pouring with rain and we had a few hours to fill before our flight. It was a great choice, but I highly recommend you skip the ground floor and start at the first floor. If you have time, go back to see the prehistoric stuff and info on Chinese clans, but you may find you want to spend too long in the first floor fascinating areas. Highlights are reconstructed tea shops, film shows with 1930s British views on life in Hong Kong, a boat which was lived in year round by the boat people, a general store, an opera theatre, puppets ,wedding ceremonies etc etc. it is really well done- and best of all - it is FREE. Allow a minimum of two hours and you could spend a lot more.

Most boring museum in the world . We found this very poorly sign posted and when we did eventually arrive there wish we hadn't bothered. We have seen many museums around the world and this is the dullest most uninspiring exhibition I have ever witnessed. It bangs on and on about stuff millions of years before Jurassic times-is anyone truly interested in the type of rocks that formed Hong Kong?The more modern stuff was difficult to find and when we did was set out in possibly the most boring way possible. I was looking forward to an inspired and enlightening history of the island and couldn't wait to get out.

One of the best museums. This rates in my top 3 museums I've ever been to. It's extremely well organised and there are 8 chronological sections on the history of Hong Kong and you are guided by the exhibits from one to the other. There are plenty of information boards to read along the way which are well written and logical so you really get the most out of the history lesson. The wow factor here is the exhibits. There are huge and so lifelike. Amazing. You have to see them to know what I mean. At the front they say they spent HKD$190m and you can tell.

Fascinating trip through time. During January it is free! And it is well worth the visit as at the moment there is a wonderful exhibition of Ming artefacts (mainly beautiful porcelain). Give the cafe a miss and instead fill up on pastries, salads, coffee at Passion on Mody road. The highlight for me was the reconstruction of shopfronts using actual materials (furniture, objects etc) to give the visitor an idea of 'old Hong Kong'. Easy to get to; I caught the 101 bus from Hong Kong island and walked a short distance.

Best Museum on the Planet !!!. I spent a full day at the Museum of History and alas! it wasn't enough time! There are eight sections, starting with Prehistoric (we're talking Cooling of the Earth) and ending with Modern Times, and every one of them was SO well done! Incredible variety of things to see, and presentation was outstanding. I have never been to such a fantastic museum before. And the price was only ten HK dollars, except Wednesdays, which are free. You should allow yourself an entire day to see this museum, whether or not you're a history buff. It will fascinate everyone. And it's right across from the Museum of Science; I'm sure that must be worthwhile too.

Very impressive museum. Skip the first three sections on Geology, and go straight to section 4 onwards, which is all about the history of Hong Kong until present day. Amazing exhibition, and all for only $10.I've visited many historical museums in my life, and this is one of the best. You won't see many genuine old relics and artifacts, but the stories and the recreated sets are of very high quality.Budget at least 1.5 hours to cover it. The museum is walking distance from Tsim Tsa Tsui MTR station.
One of the best museum ever. You can't leave Hong kong without stopping by. It's one of the best museum I have ever seen it will take you a good 3 hours but it is completely worth it.

One of the best history museums in the world. I was astonished to see this museum. So much information, well displayed, well explained, beautifuly designed sets of history. You feel like you are participating in a movie about Hong Kong throughout the years.

Cheap and lots to learn about. I visited this place for free as HK are offering free entry to most museums for the whole month of January 2016. Everything is well signposted and there is lots to learn about Hong Kong. It is not too busy and takes about 2-3 hours to walk around the whole place. It is a great place to learn about chinese culture and general history, with some videos to watch along the way.
Pretty cool museum!. Just like many history museums around the world, the museum is interesting to visit. It preserves Hong Kong's historical and cultural heritage.

A little stale!. We found the second half of the museum the most interesting. The first section is the geology and flora and fauna which appears very outdated. Once you hit the more cultural, and war related area, it is very interesting.
Cheap and interesting. This museum is quite interesting to know the old and recent history of Hong Kong. It is quite cheap, so you can pay and visit what you want if you don't have enough time.

Fantastic Museum. If you wanted to take in every single fact from every exhibit this will take days but for most people the visit will last a few hours where you will absorb most of the displays. If its raining in Hong Kong this will be a perfect attraction for you.

Great Walk-through displays. The Hong Kong Museum of History takes you on an extensive journey through HK's history from prehistoric times to the present day. They've gone to a great deal of effort with the displays creating walk-through replicas of places rather than just items behind glass. The most interesting part for me was the (relatively) modern history...the opium wars and the cession of HK, Japanese occupation and the development of modern Hong Kong. There are several full size streetscapes and alley ways with traditional shops that you can walk through, and also one of the original Hong Kong trams (yes kids you can climb aboard!). For a child of the 1960s and 1970s it was also great to see some examples of Hong Kong's manufacturing from that period particularly the old tin and plastic toys and household wares, sold in their millions to the west. A great place to visit and very cheap admission. It's also right next door to the Hong Kong Science Museum so you could do both in one day.
Interesting Visit. Quite an informative museum filled with artifacts and stories of the history of Hong Kong. Underrated and worth checking out.

Excellent. Loved the museum. When we went there was a display of Ming Dynasty artifacts, which we enjoyed and learnt a lot about that era. We also looked at the History of Hong Kong display - fantastic look back at the past and how Hong Kong evolved.

Don't Miss This!. What a wonderful museum. Alas we didn't allocate enough time to do more than the Hong Kong Story, but it was very well done, with multi-media in 3 languages (English, Cantonese, Mandarin). It's inexpensive and well-worth it. Also get the audio guide, which provides even more details, though it isn't necessary, as the exhibits are well-documented.

A Must See. If you have never been to HK make sure you visit here first. It traces the history of HK beginning with its geological formation, the first inhabitants then to various significant historical events that have contributed to what makes HK truly different (various Dynasties, archaeological artefacts, the British, Opium Wars, WWII and Japanese Occupation, redevelopment, reclamation etc. Depending on how much one can read and absorb it can take up to 3 hours. At only HK$10 (or less than AU$2) this is amazing value for such a wealth of information.
In the top 10 in HK. It's my favourite museum in HKIt's very interesting particularly with childrenYou will understand all the history of HKYou need around 3 hours to go through all rooms

Enlightening experience. Solid museum. Good if you want to know more about the history of Hong Kong and how it became what it is today. Very informative and lots of historical artifacts to look at. They designed the museum well and reproduce the different eras nicely. A good cultural visit. If you like museums, you can also get a one-week pass. The pass lets you freely visit chosen/most popular museums in Hong Kong for 1 week for an unlimited number of times. So if you get it a the Museum of History, you can visit the Science Museum which is next door. Pretty convenient!

A good place to get to know Hong Kong. A friend took me here on the weekend and it was a nice respite from the commercialism that pervades Hong Kong.There was an admission fee, which was disappointment, but I guess in many places this is common. I am lucky in that I come from a place where cultural exhibitions tend to be free. We had the added bonus on the day of an English speaking guide who was knowledgeable, clear and humorous. The museum displays all of Hong Kong's history in an interesting and accessible way. You could easily spend half a day here. Definitely worth the visit.
Always worth seeing. We visited this museum several times and when back in HK it is always worth going there to remember history but also to see the current exposition.
good museum. this museum is nice, the staff all friendly, and the place is really clean, the museum is also really educational, i learn a lot of hongkong history
Informative and free on a Wednesday!. Great rainy day activity in HK, interesting and informative insight into Hong Kongs history from the beginning.

Isn't it always nice to learn?. At first I wasn't so sure about this museum and felt bored in the dynasty and geology area because it's just not my thing - I like anthropology and modern history. Then BAM, I rounded the corner and got everything I was hoping for! The section dedicated to festivals and traditions is beautifully set up and I really enjoyed it - I even wish there had been more to it! Learning the history of Hong Kong from its days as a British colony to the Japanese invasion to becoming a world metropolis to returning to China was just fantastic. Most of my questions about Hong Kong were answered. I highly recommend it!

Hidden Gem. I went with family members who come to Hong Kong every year. They have never been to this museum before but decided to join me. It is an awesome museum. The audio and video setup is amazing. It makes you feel that you are back in time living in Hong Kong. I am a big museum attendee and they have it set up very nicely for people who don't like museums (like my family). Highly recommend everyone go there.

Probably the First Stop You Should Make, Really. I have been to Hong Kong before and the very last thing I thought of was going and spending my limited time in a museum. Well, traveling with my wife this second time around she was interested and I went along for the ride. I was pleasantly surprised and quickly realized perhaps I should have started there myself the first time around. The Museum does a great job of teaching you the history of Hong Kong from its origins to where it is today. It is not a huge museum, but it is not small either. What impressed me was ow much I learned about Hong Kong that was relevant to anyone visiting. It gave me a better appreciation of everything I saw and everything I was going to see. We could not see it all as we had somewhere to be, but we certainly enjoyed our visit and plan to return at some point in the future. If you have the time and opportunity I would highly recommend it.

Super special museum. However, the audio-guide ($20 HKD) was not worth the money. The exhibits begin with the geologic history of the Hong Kong area, move into the history of human occupation, and finally cover the various cultures found in the area. The English explanations are superb. The second exhibit for which you had to pay an additional $20 HKD for an audio-guide, was called The Radiant Ming. It contained magnificent examples of Ming dynasty ceramics, furniture and metal ware. Illustrated pamphlets were available and very informative.The book shop with many gift items/souvenirs stocked a number of books in English. If you want a bag (plastic) for your purchases, it costs 50 cents. Senior discounts; ease of access; great items to view made our visit of 3+ hours a real pleasure.

Go on Wednesdays!. Not sure what the reasoning is but lots of things are free on Wednesdays and this is one of them. A wide range of well designed exhibitions showing the history of HK as far back as 4mill. years!
Nice but not extraordinary. Museums are "must go" places for me. But I have to admit, Hong Kong Museum of History was quite far from extraordinary and exciting, though it was good.

If you're put off by museums, try this one!. Of course Hong Kong has more of a need to define and explain its history than most places and this museum does it superbly well. Using modern media, excellent displays and clear explanations, it leads the visitor from pre-history to the present day. Impressive!

An insight into the history of Hong Kong. A good place to visit on the weekend when shops can be very crowded in Kowloon. Also good for a rainy day. Admission fee is cheap (10HKD) and free on Wednesdays.Interesting for teens and adults and life size models are fun for the kids too. You can spend anything from 1-4 hours here depending on your interest. Definitely recommended for museum lovers.

Great museum. Great museum, quite acessible. Went there on one day but closed so came back the day after. It describes a lot of hks history and environnement:prehistoric ages, the flora and the fauna, the wars, the different dynasties(ming, hakka...) Great place to visit, especially on a rainy day. The museum is well managed too , and there are a couple of shows explaining. Could easily spend 4 hours in there!

Use the mini cinemas. The museum is grand in scope and execution each period is housed in large halls with huge wall backdrop to the exhibits. Each also has a small cinema in the 3 usual languages each lasting c 10 mins they a region and give your feet a rest fro the next gallery. To do it justice do in the morning when fresh to start the day I arrived at 2 and was flagging by 4 :)

Introduction of Hong Kong. Wednesday is free museums day in Hong Kong, so we also planned the science museum across and the Space museum few blocks away for the day. We came during the month of August, it was a great place to cool off and learn about the history of Hong Kong. This museum did an excellent job on all the photos and displays showing what Hong Kong was and the current time. The admission was $ 10 Hk dollar ( $1.25 US ),it is dirt cheap even you needs to pat to get in ( allow 2-3 hrs for the visit ).

Gives a good understanding of the history of Hong Kong. Great place to visit, especially on a rainy day. Also remember that museums are free on Wednesdays. The history of Hong Kong is intriguing and will enlighten your whole visit to this city.

Fantastic Museum. Amazing museum. Make sure you have alot of free time to visit it. I suppose it took us about 4 hours total to really take it all in and read every single tag. You will be surprised with the place in History HK has. It is very very well organized and not boring at any point. I guess you could fast track the initial geological part, but from then on, it´s just a gem. I would advise this to be your first stop, to set a context for the rest of your trip. If, like myself, you´ve been 100+ times to HK before checking this out, it will make you love and understand the city even more.

A good introduction to HK's history. I felt that the most interesting part was the section dealing with what happened in Hong Kong during and shortly after World War II. Fortunately HK bounced back and since has gone from strength to strength, but the 1940s and 50s must have been a very difficult period.

Great museum. You can spend a few hours in the museum of history.
It is very well organized with every era explained.
Very pretty things to see.

First stop in HK for every tourist. This should be a first stop for every tourist in Honk Kong. It's divided into several sections according the main milestones of the HK history. It's very interactive so you can expect good 2-3 hours of fun and learning about history, culture, traditions.

Great guided tour through HK's past. The best exhibit is definitely towards the end (I think it was number 6) with all the colonial buildings and shops indoors. Very nice way of spending the afternoon learning about the history of Hong Kong.

True HK history -- prehistoric times to 1997. The museum will bring back memories and trigger nostalgia for people with ties to Hong Kong. I have older friends who don't want to visit because the displays would remind them of happier times under British rule.Exhibits span prehistory times to 1997 and the handover of HK to China. They describe the various peoples who have settled in HK, the notorious enslavement of Chinese by Europe via the illegal opium trade and then a small-scale war, the spectacular growth and growing pains of Hong Kong, and, impressively, the preservation of folk crafts and religious ceremonies to this day.

Excellent Museum, well curated. 2 - 3 hours in this will educate you on the history and main attractions of Hong Kong. Good use of the space and multi-media makes this an enjoyable experience too. It covers all aspects of Hong Kong, particularly good insights on how ways of life have changed as the city evolved from a sleepy village to be a major global financial centre. Lots of on hand exhibits also make this suitable for children, especially on a hot day, or rainy outside. And if they are not done yet, then the Science Museum is just across the walkway. In a place like HK when temperature can be over 30 degree and thousands of people milling around you, this makes for a good break without feeling you are not using your time in HK widely.

Overlooked by most tourists, but worth a visit. If you get there early, before the hordes of school children, this is an overlooked gem about a 20 minute walk from the Kowloon Star Ferry. Just the story of the Opium Wars is worth the visit. Great for a rainy or hot day.

Great rainy day activity.. Went on a very wet Wednesday so was free!A very well thought out Museum.Learnt so much about Hong Kong.Cafe also good.Spent hours in total with 2 teens who were also impressed.

Impressive!. Currently having Bruce Lee exhibition and setting up exhibition hall for Kids Traditional Wear (opening next week), worth a visit and you can simply spent whole day here!! Add on: Very friendly and helpful staff.

Take a stroll through the history of Hong Kong. This museum allows you to explore the historic development from prehistoric times through colonial times to the handover of Hong Kong from the UK to China. I especially liked the sections on the Opium Wars and the early growth of the city.

Informative Museum of HK Complete History. I enjoyed learning more about Hong Kong's history and it is easy to do all under one roof here.
